page.title: 15CLUBS
page.content: There are several clubs and societies in the area some of which are well established and very important to the social life of the village. The working men's club occupies what was the Reading Room erected in 1892 to replace an inadequate room in a cottage on Blacksmith's Hill.It was used by the sporting clubs for meeting and changing until the whole village combined to raise money for a pavilion on the existing playing field. This is run by the Westbury Sports & Social Committee which incorporates the Cricket and Soccer Clubs.They organise not only their own sports but many other events and entertainments. The P.T.A.of the first school also run events.There is a W.I.,an Evergreen Club and an Arts & Craft Club.Darts are played at the Pavilion and the Reindeer Inn each week in winter.
